results.content:
The learning curve was very steep for me.  

The instructor was an expert but he flew through the material.

One of the bigger stumbling blocks for me was the  code examples provided.  Not every one worked for me, and I was following along precisely.  Downloading the course code after the module saved me from stopping half-way through but it was different than what was used in the illustrations.  This confused me.

As for the approach, it was an excellent way to attack a complicated subject. i.e. local data followed by remote data.

response.content: Thanks for the candid feedback Dave! I'll definitely take note to slow things down a bit for future courses :)
response.content_html: Thanks for the candid feedback Dave! I'll definitely take note to slow things down a bit for future courses :)

As for the approach, it was an excellent way to attack a complicated subject. i.e. local data followed by remote data.

results.content:
The fact that this course is now out of date makes things especially hard for beginners who might have not yet learned how to read migration docs. I got stuck on a problem with the new version of angular-ui-router  and then I got stuck on Firebase and AngularFire being out of date. I was able to solve this issues with a combination of the class forums, W3 schools, and StackOverflow. This course desperately needs a comprehensive update.

Another general problem with this course is that it does a poor job of wrapping everything up. For example, we are given a set of json data that includes attributes such as the date the classified ad was added, how many times it was viewed, and different categories for the items being sold. But we never find out how to actually implement these data sets into our app. Our instructor also faked data for the Contact section of the app, which is fine at first, but then he left us on our own to come up with a way to correctly implement a contact section.
results.content_html:
The fact that this course is now out of date makes things especially hard for beginners who might have not yet learned how to read migration docs. I got stuck on a problem with the new version of angular-ui-router and then I got stuck on Firebase and AngularFire being out of date. I was able to solve this issues with a combination of the class forums, W3 schools, and StackOverflow. This course desperately needs a comprehensive update.

Another general problem with this course is that it does a poor job of wrapping everything up. For example, we are given a set of json data that includes attributes such as the date the classified ad was added, how many times it was viewed, and different categories for the items being sold. But we never find out how to actually implement these data sets into our app. Our instructor also faked data for the Contact section of the app, which is fine at first, but then he left us on our own to come up with a way to correctly implement a contact section.

results.content: Good course, would've been 5 stars if it wasn't for a few things like always creating an angular module outright in practically every new file without storing it in a variable (bad idea, took me a little while to figure out, but things weren't loading properly because of it) and some other things that, naturally, are outdated and don't work with current technology (Firebase changes and whatnot)--aside from Angular 1 being a total mess which is no fault of the instructor.
results.content_html: Good course, would've been 5 stars if it wasn't for a few things like always creating an angular module outright in practically every new file without storing it in a variable (bad idea, took me a little while to figure out, but things weren't loading properly because of it) and some other things that, naturally, are outdated and don't work with current technology (Firebase changes and whatnot)--aside from Angular 1 being a total mess which is no fault of the instructor.

results.content: Everything is great until 8: UI-Router then it all falls apart. Despite matching the instructor's exact dependencies and code three times I've had to get outside help to revise his code and make the view work properly. Yes I know it's an old version of Angular but my current assignment involves upgrading from AngularJS, so it's necessary. Also the video constantly stops loading and you continually have to reload the browser and reposition the position in the player. Stay Away if you know what's good for you! I've been instructed to use Anthony Alicea's course from a trusted friend...Try it instead.

results.content:
i have, in the past, enrolled myself for a few courses on Angular on udemy. they are all v good. but, they all fall short of creating a complete crud program with data persistence capabilities. 

i'm not a programmer nor have any professional aspirations of being one; but i've been wantnig to build a utility program for myself, and being a neophyte i wanted guidance to help me get there. This tutorial has helped me fulfill that vision. 

I think it would be worthwhile to also mention that apart from Angular, getting exposure to Angular Material and Firebase was a delightful experience.

So, Ryan, thank you v much for producing this great material. I'm pretty sure it's gonna be a marquee course on Angular before long.

And if i may provide any suggestions wrt this course, i would really appreciate if you can create instructions/videos for topics like user-authentication with Firebase, along with deploying the program on Firebase.

And i request you to continue putting together great courses along the lines of building complete projects in the process.

Thank you.

response.content: Thanks for the awesome review Ashim! I'm glad you've been enjoying the course :) I'll definitely be looking to do more end-to-end courses in the future :)
response.content_html: Thanks for the awesome review Ashim! I'm glad you've been enjoying the course :) I'll definitely be looking to do more end-to-end courses in the future :)

results.content_html:
i have, in the past, enrolled myself for a few courses on Angular on udemy. they are all v good. but, they all fall short of creating a complete crud program with data persistence capabilities.

i'm not a programmer nor have any professional aspirations of being one; but i've been wantnig to build a utility program for myself, and being a neophyte i wanted guidance to help me get there. This tutorial has helped me fulfill that vision.

I think it would be worthwhile to also mention that apart from Angular, getting exposure to Angular Material and Firebase was a delightful experience.

So, Ryan, thank you v much for producing this great material. I'm pretty sure it's gonna be a marquee course on Angular before long.

And if i may provide any suggestions wrt this course, i would really appreciate if you can create instructions/videos for topics like user-authentication with Firebase, along with deploying the program on Firebase.

And i request you to continue putting together great courses along the lines of building complete projects in the process.

Thank you.

results.content: This course not only takes you through a real world practical example of how to build an application with AngularJS and firebase, but Ryan provides excellent conceptual context to what he is doing. I was able to build the majority of an app with an entirely different purpose with AngularJS after completing about 50% of this course and jumping around a bit. Ryan was extremely responsive to my questions. I've taken a few courses here with mixed results, but I would recommend this course to anyone, and if this instructor had more courses I would certainly take those as well.
results.content_html: This course not only takes you through a real world practical example of how to build an application with AngularJS and firebase, but Ryan provides excellent conceptual context to what he is doing. I was able to build the majority of an app with an entirely different purpose with AngularJS after completing about 50% of this course and jumping around a bit. Ryan was extremely responsive to my questions. I've taken a few courses here with mixed results, but I would recommend this course to anyone, and if this instructor had more courses I would certainly take those as well.

results.content:
The course is great! Ryan really takes his time to explain AngularJS so that it's easy to understand. I can finally say that I have an app that is fully functional and I can share with others immediately. This course is not like the others out there where I am left hanging with a boring app (typical to-do list) stuck on my computer. 

There are a few hiccups here and there throughout the course but if you watch the video fully, you might be able to solve your own problem or Ryan will find his own errors and you can fix it then. 

Even though I am really happy that I learned about Firebase because it's VERY easy to setup and implement into future projects, I wish that the back-end choice was PHP. I have been following Brad Hussey/ Code College for a while now and learned PHP from Brad's free PHP course and I wish that all of the Code College courses connected with each other so you could consider yourself a full stack developer. Hopefully, this would be considered in the near future since there isn't a course for AngularJS and PHP at the moment.

response.content:
Thanks Kiki, glad you liked the course!

I might look to do another course which incorporates a traditional backend, such as PHP or NodeJS. Stay tuned for that! :)
response.content_html:
Thanks Kiki, glad you liked the course!

I might look to do another course which incorporates a traditional backend, such as PHP or NodeJS. Stay tuned for that! :)

results.content_html:
The course is great! Ryan really takes his time to explain AngularJS so that it's easy to understand. I can finally say that I have an app that is fully functional and I can share with others immediately. This course is not like the others out there where I am left hanging with a boring app (typical to-do list) stuck on my computer.

There are a few hiccups here and there throughout the course but if you watch the video fully, you might be able to solve your own problem or Ryan will find his own errors and you can fix it then.

Even though I am really happy that I learned about Firebase because it's VERY easy to setup and implement into future projects, I wish that the back-end choice was PHP. I have been following Brad Hussey/ Code College for a while now and learned PHP from Brad's free PHP course and I wish that all of the Code College courses connected with each other so you could consider yourself a full stack developer. Hopefully, this would be considered in the near future since there isn't a course for AngularJS and PHP at the moment.

results.content:
Course seriously needs updating to deliver on its promise. Some of the code doesn't work because of different versions in the javascript modules used. I gave up completely at the Firebase section because Firebase is now completely different to that used in the course. I would have to read the Firebase docs (not that easy if you've never used it before) or even take a course on it before I could attempt to continue with this course. Shame really because this course did seem to be good to start with.
Will edit this rating if the course is updated.

results.content: Ryan is really good when it comes to teaching the subject, concepts are clear, goes one step at a time to make sure the student understands what he's learning. Just wish he would've been a bit slow just to make sure the student avoids the hassle of going back and forth in the videos and pausing it many times. Everything else is really good. Liked the course and the instructor, looking forward for more of his courses.

results.content: Understand the basic fundamental of AngularJS with some better content and example.
results.content_html: Understand the basic fundamental of AngularJS with some better content and example.

results.content: Great for a review and reinforcement of angular. It is a good course to use as a model that shows how to actually build an angular project for students with novice or higher angular skills, but it is too fast and not enough detail for beginners. This course is best used as a refresher, if you are a beginner you will get lost quickly. Video and audio quality are excellent. Course is laid out logically.
results.content_html: Great for a review and reinforcement of angular. This course is best used as a refresher, if you are a beginner you will get lost quickly. Video and audio quality are excellent. Course is laid out logically.

results.content:
Ryan is definitely knowledgeable instructor and he has very nice 'voice' to follow. Unfortunatelly for me I had much higher expectations to this course.

I feel like we aren't building a real-world app it's more like a demo which I would be able to built by my own without any knowledge of angular within 1-2 days...

In this course we just touch basics of AngularJS and we didn't cover more challenging aspect of this framework which I hope we do.

This course is really just an introductionary to AngularJS and you can learn the same basics from whenever you want. Nothing special about  the course.

I also don't like we are wasting a lot of time on anuglar-material which is just "css" for angularJS instead we could cover in more depth angularJS itself. It such a huge framework and it has a lot of challenges you will face during your development of "real world app" but as I already mentioned we cover just basics which is easy to follow from any tutorial on the internet...

Ryan is not a bad instructor I just find this course very easy and it didn't meet my own expecations.

What the course lacked was more complex real world implementation examples.

results.content: To me it was an easy and nicely sequenced lectured course. Also as I learned Angular 1 first, then Angular 2, it gave me good understanding to it. Quizes in the middle of the lectures was also helpful. To me, his style of teaching is great.

results.content: This course is pretty good, a few errors that can take sometime to catch so if you see a issue with your code be sure to check the comments to see if someone has caught and found a solution. 2 wishes I have for the course: 1.  the instructor response to questions was a little faster,2. more projects. But overall a top udemy course

results.content: Glad there is a good angular 1.x course out there with very swift and good detail explanation on major concepts. Thank you.

results.content: Very clear and detailed steps about how to set up and build an application from beginning to end. With helpful explanations as to why things are done a certain way.
results.content_html: Very clear and detailed steps about how to set up and build an application from beginning to end. With helpful explanations as to why things are done a certain way.

results.content:
Overall this course a good starting point for learning AngularJS, however the course is outdated and does not cover in-depth material of AngularJS. 
It would also be great if the instructor explained a bit behind the scenes of what is happening with Angular and how the different files are loaded. Also he could explain more about how you are using Angular Material and all this md classes and directives. 
I am a web developer that have only been using jQuery until now and was hard for me to grasp the way  Angular is loaded, which libraries I am actually using, the API docs of these libraries and what else I can use.
results.content_html:
Overall this course a good starting point for learning AngularJS, however the course is outdated and does not cover in-depth material of AngularJS.
It would also be great if the instructor explained a bit behind the scenes of what is happening with Angular and how the different files are loaded. Also he could explain more about how you are using Angular Material and all this md classes and directives.
I am a web developer that have only been using jQuery until now and was hard for me to grasp the way Angular is loaded, which libraries I am actually using, the API docs of these libraries and what else I can use.

results.content: This class is what I was looking for and I am thankful for it.  I understand that versions get upgraded and I was specifically looking for scope and material design using AngularJS (not 2+) - so this course is what I need.  Make sure to pay attention to installing the versions of AngularJS 1.X, angular-material, angular-aria, and angular-animations and mdi in the set up demo.
results.content_html: This class is what I was looking for and I am thankful for it. I understand that versions get upgraded and I was specifically looking for scope and material design using AngularJS (not 2+) - so this course is what I need. Make sure to pay attention to installing the versions of AngularJS 1.X, angular-material, angular-aria, and angular-animations and mdi in the set up demo.

results.content:
So far, the material has been covered appropriately. The exercises are well-explained and pretty good. I have never known about the Angular Material before this class. It is pretty interesting. There are so many things to cover to be a pretty good web developer. 

I am not sure how much the Angular Material Design has been getting used by the web community. I hear a lot about the Bootstrap library. In that sense, I would have been very happy if the course has been covered with Bootstrap and jQuery. Probably, there will be another course with AngularJS, Bootstrap and jQuery.

Come on Mr. Ryan.  Please create another course with Angular and Bootstrap.
results.content_html:
So far, the material has been covered appropriately. The exercises are well-explained and pretty good. I have never known about the Angular Material before this class. It is pretty interesting. There are so many things to cover to be a pretty good web developer.

In that sense, I would have been very happy if the course has been covered with Bootstrap and jQuery. Probably, there will be another course with AngularJS, Bootstrap and jQuery.

results.content: Very good training for creating an app with both AngularJS and Angular Material. Not a lot of details in terms of the technical aspects of the code, but if you have some Javascript knowledge, you can follow along. After going through 75% of the course, I can say that you get a lot of know how on different aspects of a SPA: user experience, other JS libraries, etc. SO far, excellent course. As I finished this course, I feel motivated to begin to design and develop my first SPA. One piece of knowledge I wanted to get form this course was integration with FIREBASE. There is not a lot under the hood details, but enough to get you started. In summary, a nice course to get started building complete SPA with a backend. If you don't have a lot of knowledge on AngularJS, I would recommend to take first a more theoretical course. Then what Ryan teaches here will make more sense.
results.content_html: Very good training for creating an app with both AngularJS and Angular Material. Not a lot of details in terms of the technical aspects of the code, but if you have some Javascript knowledge, you can follow along. After going through 75% of the course, I can say that you get a lot of know how on different aspects of a SPA: user experience, other JS libraries, etc. SO far, excellent course. As I finished this course, I feel motivated to begin to design and develop my first SPA. One piece of knowledge I wanted to get form this course was integration with FIREBASE. There is not a lot under the hood details, but enough to get you started. In summary, a nice course to get started building complete SPA with a backend. If you don't have a lot of knowledge on AngularJS, I would recommend to take first a more theoretical course. Then what Ryan teaches here will make more sense.

results.content: this course does not show how to write angular right, everything is written in a very wastefull manner. for example - the Instructor is abusing the $scope. It'd be better to use one way data binding most occasions instead.
results.content_html: this course does not show how to write angular right, everything is written in a very wastefull manner. for example - the Instructor is abusing the $scope. It'd be better to use one way data binding most occasions instead.

results.content:
Great course, but just a bit outdated in parts. The instructor explains what he's doing very clearly, and the videos and project is organized perfectly. I like how he introduces new concepts AS we build the app, whenever the new concepts needed to complete that part of the app... that keeps it interesting and the app comes together much more quickly.

Tip to author: AngularJS is deprecated BUT it's still heavily used in the real world. Many jobs still ask for this, and I'm one of many who is now learning AngularJS in 2019 (and I already know Angular 2+). In my opinion it would be a good move to create a new course from scratch using the latest version. It would be the only course on Udemy that is up to date, and will always be (since it won't ever change) :)
results.content_html:

results.content: This course is actually quite good until you get to the last couple sections where you use Firebase to host data for the application. The information provided for using Firebase is extremely out of date. One of the instructor's responses in a Q&A points to a migration document, but it's not going to get you where you need to be. Without updates to the class itself you will most likely be unable to complete the course.

results.content: Ryan is a fascinating programmer, capable of seeing a complex system in his mind. This is the very ability that prevents him from consistently communicating his vast knowledge to the less experienced: when everything it simple to you, you can't imagine somebody tripping over these simple bits and therefore can't imagine the need to explain them, like "use strict".
